description: Just Another Team's recommendations for Season 12. Recommended for Mouse and Keyboard.
name: Just Another Team's MnK rolls - Season 12

data.description: Pulses do appear to be range capped, so like Cold Denial, it’s best to focus on stability if you get Killing Wind since KW adds +20 range, + 50 mobility, and +~40  handling.
Pulses do appear to be range capped, so like Cold Denial, it’s best to focus on stability if you get Killing Wind since KW adds +20 range, + 50 mobility, and +~40  handling.
The best PvE Slug returns in a brand new craftable form. The old classics remain the best for PvE.

The absolute best in PvP has a lot more options now - some of which are at the same level as our best in slot suggestions. Heritage has a unique combo of Hip Fire Grip and Offhand Strike, turning it into a miniature Legendary Chaperone after a kill, with hipfire kills at 14 metres with Offhand proc’d

While most of the PvE roll for Succession has stayed the same, the final perk has diversified quite a bit from the first release. While Vorpal is still excellent for certain places (Cyclops’, etc), Focused Fury rises to the top for single target damage while solo, as it procs off only two shots despite having many more in the mag with Reconstruction and having Firing Line for dps in a team.
In PvP we’ve lost Killing Wind, but No Distractions keeps this sniper as one of the best for PvP
Rapid hit affects knocking speed, stability affects max hold time of fully drawn bow.
With x5 Swash, the bow can 1 tap to the head in PvP, making it a pretty good legendary pairing for bowswaps.
Rapid hit affects knocking speed, stability affects max hold time of fully drawn bow.
With x5 Swash, the bow can 1 tap to the head in PvP, making it a pretty good legendary pairing for bowswaps.
Don’t bother using this rocket for PvP, there are better options. However for PvE it’s one of two Precision Frame rockets if you’re more interested in the tracking than a damage perk

Not as strong of rolls as Interference, but still can get 7 spike grenades with backup mag. Spike grenades benefit from reduced blast radius as that shifts more damage to impact damage. Velocity barrels are acceptable, but avoid Confined Launch and Volatile Launch if using spike grenades.
We want increased blast radius when using Proximity Grenades - but not at the cost of other stats.

When using Iron Grip, make sure you run a hand cannon loader mod. This returns you to the base reload of the weapon and makes sure you lose nothing.
When using Iron Grip, make sure you run a hand cannon loader mod. This returns you to the base reload of the weapon and makes sure you lose nothing.
If you chose Iron Grip, then Flared Magwell/Alloy Mag become more wanted perks to help counter the greatly decreased reload of Iron Grip.

Opening Shot is arguably the best in slot perk. Rangefinder is generally the go to (it does add ~3M of base range) but Hawkmoon is a run and gun weapon (in my opinion) - if you want range, run a 120 or Luna Faction boots. Opening Shot gives a serious bonus to accuracy on ground and in air and helps guarantee landing the first crit (or 7 stack OHKO if you wait for perk to reset). Moving Target is nearly worthless due to high base AA stat.

Rangefinder is generally the go to (it does add ~3M of base range) but Hawkmoon is a run and gun weapon (in my opinion) - if you want range, run a 120 or Luna Faction boots. Opening Shot gives a serious bonus to accuracy on ground and in air and helps guarantee landing the first crit (or 7 stack OHKO if you wait for perk to reset). Moving Target is nearly worthless due to high base AA stat.
1-2p and TB increase burst DPS but do not increase total DPS due to the time it takes to proc the perk. Pick the perks that have the most synergy with your playstyle.
Slideshot and Killing Wind each add ~20 range stat making 86+ range possible. However, pellet spread RNG is the determinant factor for one hit kills.

Despite the 1000 charge time damaging the feel of these fusions it’s still a good choice for single shot burst damage on Majors and Yellow bars.
For PvP, just don’t bother. The charge time change neutered the effectiveness of High Impact frames in pretty much any use cases

Chosen Variant. Kickstart is a nice perk to reduce the charge time slightly, but has a very small period to proc it (needs charging during slide to ensure that you don’t lose the perk half way through the burst), and requires you to play a certain way to best use the perk (sprinting with a fusion out in order to get the perk to proc, leaving you vulnerable to a shotgun push or ranged primary fire).
Worthy Variant
Worthy Variant
Chosen Variant.

Despite having a TT + Vorpal god roll, other adaptive snipers are better for dps thanks to Adored not getting a 7 mag. Adored shines in PvP however, with an automatic 5/5 god roll from the start.

In PvE, the poor performance of the Precision hc is balanced with the excellent and unique perk pool. As the first weapon with Voltshot in the 3rd column, Posterity is worth getting for uniqueness alone - though the perks do elevate it into being usable despite the poor archetype.
In PvP this is just another Precision hc without an especially special damage perk to enable three taps, and no consistency perks. Better to look elsewhere for PvP

In PvP this is just another Precision hc without an especially special damage perk to enable three taps, and no consistency perks. Better to look elsewhere for PvP

Not half bad in PvE as a Incandescent rapid fire scout
Trustee shines in PvP with damage perks like HIR or Focused Fury. Letting a rapid fire lower it’s ttk makes them very strong, and HIR gives a consistent method without needing a kill

Commemoration reclaims its spot as the best Machine Gun in the game. The only Adaptive MG with Killing Tally and methods to get around manual reloading with Subsistence and Reconstruction makes this easily the best PvE Machine Gun. Reconstruction especially can let you fire all the reserves without ever losing your Killing Tally stacks.
For PvP - Don’t Bother. No good consistency or damage perks makes this pointless for use there compared to other MGs

Bequest now has a unique place as a craftable sword with Surrounded - one of the best damage perks on Swords in places where it can be proc’d. Otherwise it has Chain Reaction for sword add clear, and a number of other classic sword perks
